citeinfo.origin: Fisheries and Oceans Canada - Ocean Science And Productivity, Pacific
citeinfo.title: Free-drifting Sediment Trap Array (FDSTAr) at Station Papa, 1998-present

descript.abstract: Data from free-drifting sediment traps deployed at Ocean Station Papa, for short periods of time, three times per year, 19xx to 2000 (continuing)
descript.purpose: Quantity and composition of particle flux from upper layers of open ocean.
descript.supplinf: Risk Justification: Custodian will be leaving soon and has a large quantity of data not secured in a regional data centre. Risk of Loss: High Impact Justification: Long term time series (more than 10 years) Impact of Loss: High Recommended Action: Obtain access to the data bring to archives.

idinfo.useconst: Data have not been published, not quality checked.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

dataqual.logic: For C:N, biogenic silicate, CaCO3: subsamples of a sample collected at station papa (a historical sample) are analyzed with each set of data to check for continuity. Zooplankton that may have swum into the trap are removed by hand. Silicate concentrations are compared to prepared standards.
dataqual.complete: Dataset Complications: Some gaps in the data due to trap malfunction.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

stdorder.nondig: Hardcopy Original Exists: Y Hardcopy Locations: Janet Barwell-Clarke, Rm 1408, IOS Hardcopy Description: Binders of raw data and deck sheets.

stdorder.ordering: Electronic Data Doc Locations: Header information in each file Dataset Locations: IOS Climate Chemistry shared hard drive
